meanings.definition: A condition in which one type of stimulation evokes the sensation of another, as when the hearing of a sound produces the visualization of a color.
meanings.sent1: Her synaesthesias made music feel like a painting.
meanings.sent2: The artist experienced synaesthesias, seeing colors when hearing melodies.
meanings.sent3: At the concert, his synaesthesias turned the music into a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The synaesthesias of the forest whispered colors to her ears.
meanings.sent5: His synaesthesias painted the world in a symphony of hues.

meanings.definition: The production of a sense impression relating to one sense or part of the body by stimulation of another sense or part of the body.
meanings.sent1: The synaesthesias of touch made her taste the texture of the fabric.
meanings.sent2: His synaesthesias caused him to feel sounds as physical sensations.
meanings.sent3: The chef's synaesthesias led to a dish that tasted like a sunset.
meanings.sent4: In her synaesthesias, the scent of flowers felt like a gentle touch.
meanings.sent5: The synaesthesias of the ocean breeze carried the taste of salt on his skin.
